channel.title: USPTO Other Events
channel.description: This feed provides easy access to USPTO Other events.

item.title: Commercializing intellectual property, part 1: Licensing technical IP in China
What you need to sell your arts and crafts online: Pricing your art products online, for Native American visual artists and craftspeople
PPAC fireside chat with Director Kathi Vidal
item.description: Join the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) and Patent Public Advisory Committee (PPAC) at the next public PPAC meeting to hear newly-confirmed Director Kathi Vidal answer USPTO stakeholder questions. The PPAC advises the Under Secretary of Commerce for Intellectual Property and Director of the USPTO on patent-related policies, goals, performance, budget, and user fees.

item.title: Fundamentos básicos de las patentes
item.description: Si tiene una invención o una idea para un posible producto, no se pierda esta oportunidad. Exploraremos las diferentes clases o tipos de patentes, incluyendo patentes de utilidad, patentes de diseño, y patentes de plantas. Adicionalmente, explicaremos la diferencia y el uso de solicitudes (aplicaciones) de patentes provisionales y no-provisionales.

item.title: The Hand of History-The Mind of the Inventor Session 2: Television
item.description: Join us for a month-long journey into the history of innovation by registering for the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) webinar series, The Hand of History—The Mind of the Inventor. The series will focus on 20th century inventions, led by a group of historians with great stories to tell about specific inventors, their patents, and the crucial role of invention in economic progress from the 1900s to the 1950s.

item.title: Patent basics
item.description: Are you interested in learning about the basics of intellectual property (IP) and patents?

item.title: PPAC fireside chat with Director Kathi Vidal
item.description: Join the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) and Patent Public Advisory Committee (PPAC) at the next public PPAC meeting to hear newly-confirmed Director Kathi Vidal answer USPTO stakeholder questions. The PPAC advises the Under Secretary of Commerce for Intellectual Property and Director of the USPTO on patent-related policies, goals, performance, budget, and user fees.

item.title: The Hand of History-The Mind of the Inventor Session 2: Television
item.description: Join us for a month-long journey into the history of innovation by registering for the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) webinar series, The Hand of History—The Mind of the Inventor. The series will focus on 20th century inventions, led by a group of historians with great stories to tell about specific inventors, their patents, and the crucial role of invention in economic progress from the 1900s to the 1950s.

item.title: Learn how to conduct a patent search
item.description: Are you interested in learning more about patent searching?

item.title: Proud Innovation 2022, part one: From ideas to innovations
item.description: Do you have an idea you want to bring to life? Join the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) to get inspired by successful innovators turning concepts into creations. Register for the free, online Proud Innovation 2022 series, part one: From ideas to innovations.

item.title: Proud Innovation 2022, part one: From ideas to innovations
item.description: Do you have an idea you want to bring to life? Join the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) to get inspired by successful innovators turning concepts into creations. Register for the free, online Proud Innovation 2022 series, part one: From ideas to innovations.

item.title: Patent Quality Chat: Sequence listings under ST.26 and new USPTO rules
item.description: Learn about World Intellectual Property Organization (WIPO) Standard ST.26 and upcoming changes to sequence listings filed in patent applications that contain disclosures of nucleotide and/or amino acid sequences. Standard ST.26, requiring XML formatting, will go into effect worldwide on July 1, 2022, and the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) is adopting new rules (37 CFR 1.831-1.835 and 1.839) to implement this standard.

item.title: Fundamentos básicos de las marcas registradas
item.description: Esta sesión es imprescindible para cualquier emprendedor o negocio pequeño interesado en obtener una marca registrada. Exploraremos los tipos diferentes de marcas registradas, incluyendo nombres de las marcas, diseños, logotipos, e imágenes comerciales.

item.title: Trademark basics
item.description: Are you an entrepreneur or a small business owner? Do you have a name or logo you are using to advertise your business?

item.title: The Hand of History-The Mind of the Inventor Session 3: Automobiles and Aviation
item.description: Join us for a month-long journey into the history of innovation by registering for the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) webinar series, The Hand of History—The Mind of the Inventor. The series will focus on 20th century inventions, led by a group of historians with great stories to tell about specific inventors, their patents, and the crucial role of invention in economic progress from the 1900s to the 1950s.

item.title: Proud Innovation 2022, part two: From enthusiasm to entrepreneurship
item.description: Are you passionate about taking your special idea to the market? Join the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) to learn how to commercialize your innovation. Register for the free, online Proud Innovation 2022 series, part two: From enthusiasm to entrepreneurship.

item.title: Proud Innovation 2022, part two: From enthusiasm to entrepreneurship
item.description: Are you passionate about taking your special idea to the market? Join the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) to learn how to commercialize your innovation. Register for the free, online Proud Innovation 2022 series, part two: From enthusiasm to entrepreneurship.

item.title: Learn how examiners approach 35 U.S.C. § 103 examining evidence
item.description: Would you like to learn more about examination practices and procedural guidance for 35 U.S.C. § 103 examining evidence? Register today for part three of the United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) virtual Instructor-Led Training (vILT) series on June 28. The course has limited capacity, and selection for attendance is based on a first-come, first-served basis.

item.description: Si desea aprender acerca de las opciones disponibles para ayudar a proteger su propiedad intelectual (PI) en jurisdicciones extranjeras, no deje pasar la oportunidad de participar en esta sesión informativa.

item.title: Learn how to protect your technology abroad
item.description: Did you know that you can seek patent protection in another country?

item.title: Intellectual property basics and helpful resources
item.description: Unfamiliar with patents, trademarks, copyrights, and trade secrets? Don't miss this opportunity to learn from United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) experts about intellectual property (IP) basics and potential ways to protect your innovation as you transition from idea to product.

item.title: Blockchain & IP: Truth over trust
item.description: The utilization of non-fungible tokens (NFTs), geofencing, and biometrics are being investigated to create a future that relies on truth over trust. Join the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) for a discussion about this developing technology that will revolutionize the way people conduct transactions.

item.title: K-12 IP education office hours
K-12 IP education office hours
Trademark Public Advisory Committee quarterly meeting
item.description: Attend the next quarterly meeting of the United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) Trademark Public Advisory Committee (TPAC) to learn more about trademark-related policies, goals, performance, budgets, and user fees. The TPAC advises the Under Secretary of Commerce for Intellectual Property and Director of the USPTO. The public meeting agenda will be available one week before the scheduled meeting.

item.title: Intellectual property basics and helpful resources
item.description: Unfamiliar with patents, trademarks, copyrights, and trade secrets? Don't miss this opportunity to learn from United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) experts about intellectual property (IP) basics and potential ways to protect your innovation as you transition from idea to product.

Blockchain & IP: Cross section of blockchain, patents, and open source
item.description: Join the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) and East Coast Attorney James Gatto to investigate the intersection of blockchain, patents, and open source and the interesting legal issues they present.

item.title: Propiedad intelectual 101
item.description: ¿Desea familiarizarse con las patentes, las marcas registradas, los derechos de autor, y los secretos comerciales? De ser así, le invitamos para que aprenda acerca de los fundamentos básicos de la propiedad intelectual (PI) y las formas potenciales de proteger sus innovaciones durante su transición de una idea al producto.

item.title: Intellectual property 101
item.description: Do you want to know more about patents, trademarks, copyrights, and trade secrets? Join us for a free, virtual session to learn about intellectual property (IP) basics and potential ways to protect your innovations as you transition from idea to product.

item.title: International agents and attorneys: Learn to think like a patent examiner with STEPP's four-day course - RESCHEDULED
item.description: If you are a United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) registered patent attorney or an agent residing internationally (i.e. outside of the United States), you can get a better understanding of how patent examiners make decisions at the Stakeholder Training on Examination Practice and Procedure (STEPP) agent/attorney four-day course, held from September 13-16, 2022.

item.title: Blockchain & IP: USC 101 patent eligibility in blockchain
item.description: Claims define the boundaries of intellectual property just as property lines define the boundaries of a house. Over the past few years, USC 101 has been clarified regarding patent eligibility as inventions in the digital space because they do not always produce tangible end results.

item.description: Hear about the innovations and inventions in supply chain management, credit cards, insurance, and banking that companies along the United States Eastern seaboard are pursuing. These real-world use cases will delight and inspire your outlook of the future.
